Posts.Content: I am finishing chemo for a receptor positive breast cancer and the doctor wants to give me either Tamoxifen or aromatase inhibitors.I teach fitness and do not want to be under fatigue etc for so long. Is there any alternative to these therapy that can prevent recurrence? Grace
Posts.Title: alternative treatment to aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: Thank you for the information.I was told D-glucorate,indolplex are good supplements for receptor positive cancers.I still have one more chemo to go through and then I will have to see the oncologyst to discuss the treatment that follows.  I am in Los Angeles .I did not trust the people I saw in the natural field very not commited and not reliable. Maybe,I should combine the therapies for best results and less side effects. Thanks a lot,
Posts.Title: alternative treatment to aromatase inhibitors

Posts.Content: Hi I went through double mastectomy and total lmphs removel in the left arn because there was one lymph node affected.The right was OK but they removes some to test.Nothing was there. This was in August 2007 , I had full plastic reconstruction in March 2008.I worked out but never felt anything. I am a fitness instructor and also use the steam room and jacuzzy.I have been feeling a pain in the night I don't know if can be nerves in the arm or the veins are recuperating from the chemo.I have been back to my activity a month ago and sometimes carry heavy bag or food since I do not have any help.   The pain or numbness is in the arm and I have joint pain in the middle of the thumb and index finger more in the right arm and hand than in the left.   Anybody knows something about it.I will not stop my activity and do a lot in the water but never felt anything and my arms are not swelling.   Thanks a lot,
Posts.Title: Pain and numbness of arms and hands

Posts.Content: Thanks for the answer.No,I am not taking any medicine. Grace
Posts.Title: Pain and numbness of arms and hands

Posts.Content: If you refer to the reconstruction check with UCLA harbor or USC university
Posts.Title: medicare don't pay

Posts.Content: I had a bilateral mastectomy and going through my last cycle of chemo.y doctor said I had to follow with aromatase or Tamoxifen.I teach fitness and I have to work out everyday.I was told I had osteopenia in the arms.I don't want to become old before my time due to drugs when I never took even an aspirin.I ws forced into menoupause for the chemo. The doctor said that taking hormone therahy increases a 12%  life expectancy and the 5 years of medication extend to almost 20 not just to 5. The side effects are not general and depends on each person and is possible to withdraw  the drug if they are ruining your quality of life.
Posts.Title: Refusing Arimidex

Posts.Content: I had a bilateral mastectomy and going through my last cycle of chemo.y doctor said I had to follow with aromatase or Tamoxifen.I teach fitness and I have to work out everyday.I was told I had osteopenia in the arms.I don't want to become old before my time due to drugs when I never took even an aspirin.I ws forced into menoupause for the chemo. The doctor said that taking hormone therahy increases a 12%  life expectancy and the 5 years of medication extend to almost 20 not just to 5. The side effects are not general and depends on each person and is possible to withdraw  the drug if they are ruining your quality of life.
Posts.Title: Refusing Arimidex

Posts.Content: My complementary doctor gave me isoflavone to mitigate menopause syntomes caused by chemotherapy.I had ER positive .These are phytoestrogens not estrogens that are supposed to be good for us. Are phytoestrogens that are supposed to help the bad effects of menopause (induced by chemo) a risk for breast cancer?  Thanks, Grace
Posts.Title: ISOFLAVONES
